author: Staff Reporter
text:
A state-of-the-art Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scan facility has been established at Thoothukudi Government Medical College Hospital.

Chief Minister Jayalalithaa inaugurated the facility through video conferencing on Tuesday.

The facility was set up at a cost of Rs. 7.5 crore under public private partnership mode, sources said.

The facility would be available round-the-clock and the needy could utilize it at any time.

Normally, Rs. 9,000 was charged for the MRI scan in private clinics.

But, any patient in need of MRI scan needs to pay Rs.2,300 in the Government Hospital here.

After taking the MRI scan, report would be readied in thirty minutes, sources said.

S.T. Chellapandian, Thoothukudi MLA and Mayor of Corporation A.P.R. Anthony Grace visited the scanning facility.

B. Santhakumar, Dean, Silas Jeyamani, Resident Medical Officer and doctors were also present.
title: Thoothukudi GH gets MRI scan facility
